metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5470 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The label decompression functionality in PowerDNS Recursor before 3.6.4 and 3.7.x before 3.7.3 and Authoritative (Auth) Server before 3.3.3 and 3.4.x before 3.4.5 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption or crash) via a request with a long name that refers to itself.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2015-1868.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5470` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

pdns-backend-geoip - 3.4.5-1
pdns-backend-ldap - 3.4.5-1
pdns-backend-lua - 3.4.5-1
pdns-backend-mydns - 3.4.5-1
pdns-backend-mysql - 3.4.5-1
pdns-backend-pgsql - 3.4.5-1
pdns-backend-pipe - 3.4.5-1
pdns-backend-remote - 3.4.5-1
pdns-backend-sqlite3 - 3.4.5-1
pdns-backend-tinydns - 3.4.5-1
pdns-server - 3.4.5-1
pdns-tools - 3.4.5-1
No subscription required

pdns-recursor - 3.7.3-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> incomplete fix for CVE-2015-1868 only affected pdns 3.2+ and pdns-recursor 3.5+

criterions.comment: pdns package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.5-1').
pdns-recursor package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.7.3-1').
